result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua L Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. To reimburse Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Joshua L Krueger in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, advises of some errors found in the PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Joshua L Krueger in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State requests an undated PSI in this file now that defendant has entered pleas in 16-CM-109. Court orders DOC to update latest PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Joshua L Krueger in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. File will track 16-CF-109. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews PSI from DOC. Atty Gerber requests adjournment of sentencing hearing, hasn't had time to thoroughly go through PSI with defendant. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates matter is close to resolving, requests another date in June to allow him some more time to talk to defendant about the case. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber indicates they are close to resolving the matter, requests another status in 3 weeks. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Joshua L Krueger in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers received discovery but hasn't had time to review it yet, requests another status. State feels this case has been dragging on, asks court to set matter for trial. Court sets another status. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek indicates his office hasn't seen discovery yet, would like to see that and talk to Atty Gerbers before proceeding. Atty Maciolek requests a status in January. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
